articles.headline: Tensions Escalate as Stakes Grow in Fiscal Clash
articles.snippet: Across Washington, officials were weighed down with a sense that they were hurtling toward a crisis, and the pressure was particularly intense on Republican leaders.
articles.abstract: Across Washington, officials were weighed down with a sense that they were hurtling toward a crisis, and the pressure was particularly intense on Republican leaders.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, warned on Wednesday of a “huge financial calamity” if President Obama and the Republicans cannot agree on a budget deal that allows the federal debt ceiling to be increased. Moody’s, the ratings agency, threatened a credit downgrade, citing a “rising possibility” that no deal would be reached before the government’s borrowing authority hits its limit on Aug. 2.

articles.headline: Google+ Improves on Facebook
articles.snippet: Google+, Google’s social network, has easy-to-use privacy controls and allows video chats with as many as 10 people.
articles.abstract: Google+, Google’s social network, has easy-to-use privacy controls and allows video chats with as many as 10 people.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google, the most popular Web site on earth, is worried about the second-most popular site. That, of course, would be Facebook.

articles.headline: New Service Offers Music in Quantity, Not by Song
articles.snippet: Rather than selling individual tracks to be downloaded, Spotify, from Europe, sells subscriptions to vast catalogs of music.
articles.abstract: Rather than selling individual tracks to be downloaded, Spotify, from Europe, sells subscriptions to vast catalogs of music.
articles.lead_paragraph: Daniel Ek, the 28-year-old co-founder and public face of Spotify, the European digital music service, paced around the company’s loftlike Manhattan office on Tuesday afternoon, clutching two mobile phones that buzzed constantly.

articles.headline: Amazon Takes On California
articles.snippet: Amazon has an ambitious and far-reaching new agenda: it wants to rewrite tax policy for the Internet era.
articles.abstract: Amazon has an ambitious and far-reaching new agenda: it wants to rewrite tax policy for the Internet era.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Amazon, the world’s largest online merchant, has an ambitious and far-reaching new agenda: it wants to rewrite tax policy for the Internet era.
articles.byline: By Matt Richtel and Verne G. Kopytoff

articles.headline: Father and Son Split on Tactics in Murdoch Family Drama
articles.snippet: A family drama played out during the decision by Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation to withdraw a bid for British Sky Broadcasting.
articles.abstract: A family drama played out during the decision by Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation to withdraw a bid for British Sky Broadcasting.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation announced Wednesday that it was withdrawing its $12 billion bid to buy complete control of the satellite giant British Sky Broadcasting, a move intended to calm the torrent of derision directed at the company since journalists at its British newspapers were implicated in a widespread phone-hacking scheme.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and John F. Burns

articles.headline: Housing Boom, if You’re a Bird
articles.snippet: In an area where residents try to attract a creature whose nest has value, birdhouses have been proliferating.
articles.abstract: In an area where residents try to attract a creature whose nest has value, birdhouses have been proliferating.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUKADANA, Indonesia — Along the spine-jarring road that runs through this city on the South China Sea, in between the sparse, waterlogged shacks of corrugated aluminum and wood, colorful buildings have begun to sprout.

articles.headline: Utility Shelves Ambitious Plan to Limit Carbon
articles.snippet: The abandonment of the United States’ most prominent plan to capture carbon dioxide from an existing coal-burning power plant hurts efforts to rein in emissions tied to global warming.
articles.abstract: The abandonment of the United States’ most prominent plan to capture carbon dioxide from an existing coal-burning power plant hurts efforts to rein in emissions tied to global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A major American utility is shelving the nation’s most prominent effort to capture carbon dioxide from an existing coal-burning power plant, dealing a severe blow to efforts to rein in emissions responsible for global warming.
articles.byline: By Matthew L. Wald and John M. Broder

articles.headline: To Track Militants, U.S. Has System That Never Forgets a Face
articles.snippet: The American military and local authorities are recording identifying information of Iraqis and Afghans.
articles.abstract: The American military and local authorities are recording identifying information of Iraqis and Afghans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the Taliban dug an elaborate tunnel system beneath the largest prison in southern Afghanistan this spring, they set off a scramble to catch the 475 inmates who escaped.
